title: Old Wounds
description: 5 STARS"It was so believable and interesting" Grace, Book Like Breathing5 STARS“Wow. This book was amazing.”Andrea, Books, Baking, and Other Objects of Beauty5 STARS“engrossing, a page-turner”Francine, Goodreads.com4 STARS“I throughly enjoyed Old Wounds and could not put it down once I started reading it.” Bonnie, Hands and HomeSummary for Old Sent to live with her estranged father, troubled seventeen year Sophia Young is biding her time until school is over and freedom is hers. But running from her painful past is not as easy as she was expecting, especially after meeting a kindred spirit in Elliott Dalton, the shy, withdrawn son of a prominent doctor.In the first novel of the series, they are paired together in therapy; a seemingly unlikely pair who have nothing in common.Or do they?For Sophia and Elliott are about to learn that appearances can be deceiving...**(excerpt)He looked tired. I wanted to talk to him, but it was incredibly awkward. There was no privacy at school and what the hell would I have said anyway? Most of the class I just daydreamed about being somewhere else. I did my best to ignore that somehow I had managed to let Red Dalton get under my skin.It was so messed up. I was so messed up. Sophie’s number one rule was to not let anyone in; especially stupid high school boys.But he wasn’t stupid.Learn more about N. K. Smith at thewriterscoffeeshop.com/nsmithNeed more Elliott and Sophie? Search Little Battles and Weight of the World
author: N.K. Smith
